intro: Raphanistrum microcarpum, commonly known as the dwarf smartweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a reddish midrib. Its small, yellowish flowers are borne in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and the plant produces small, indehiscent fruits called achenes. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
